intro: Sympa riograndensis, commonly known as the Rio Grande sympa, is a flowering plant native to the grasslands of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30 to 60 centimeters and features narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Sympa riograndensis is adapted to dry conditions and is often found in open habitats with well-drained soils.
